{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:16.000
    | text      = This has to do with a piece of legislation passed in 2003 in Washington titled WAC 246-100-040

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:25.000
    | text      = This legislation allows local health officials to quarantine individuals or groups of people
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:42.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:44.000

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:48.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:51.000
    | text      = In June 2020, the Board of Health passed the Engrossed Substitute House Bill 1551

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:58.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:06.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:11.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:17.000
    | text      = This section, WAC 246-100, is something that has a slot in the agenda at every Board of Health meeting

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:25.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:33:30.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
